title: Cotton yield per harvested acre in the U.S. 2000 to 2019
summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes Yield per acre in pounds. In total the number of data points it has is 20.
Overall Yield per acre in pounds has increased over the Year.
The most drastic increase took place within the Year 2003 and 2004.
The highest Yield per acre in pounds, of value 905.0 was reached at Year 2017
The lowest Yield per acre in pounds, of value 632.0 was reported at Year 2000
